etymology.description: Semantic: 氵(水) (shuǐ, "water") + Phonetic: 十 (shí, "ten") -> fluid-like water -> juice
etymology.interpretation: The character 汁(汁) combines 氵(水) (shuǐ, "water") to signify a liquid and 十 (shí, "ten") for its phonetic value. Together, they convey the idea of a fluid or liquid extract, much like juice.

examples.chinese: 他从柠檬中榨出酸汁(他從檸檬中榨出酸汁)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cóng níngméng zhōng zhà chū suān zhī.
examples.english: He squeezed sour juice from a lemon.

examples.chinese: 鲜果汁很适合夏天饮用(鮮果汁很適合夏天飲用)。
examples.pinyin: Xiān guǒ zhī hěn shìhé xiàtiān yǐnyòng.
examples.english: Fresh fruit juice is perfect for summer drinking.

examples.chinese: 妈妈为我调了混合果汁(媽媽為我調了混合果汁)，加了一点蜂蜜(加了一點蜂蜜)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā wèi wǒ tiáo le hùnhé guǒ zhī, jiā le yīdiǎn fēngmì.
examples.english: Mom made a mixed fruit juice for me, adding a little honey.
